comments.text:
Well, I honestly think Windows 8.1 is way better than Windows 7. I have a

comments.author: Joseph Kendrick

comments.text:
+The Derp Squad There is nothing wrong with Linux, it is a pretty handy 
operating system. My problem with Microsoft is they're trying to nudge 
their users into adapting bullshit that nobody wants (Windows 8). I own a 
computer, not a tablet (and I never want a tablet). However, Windows 8 was 
designed from the ground up to be targeted and applied for use on tablets, 
or tablet-esque laptops (touchscreens, removable keyboards, etc). I am 
aware that the new Windows 8.1 comes with a "Desktop Mode" where it will 
closely resemble it's predecessors in terms of appears and ease of use, but 
it's ease of use is still not as open, easy, and versatile as Windows 7. 
When I built my gaming PC last year, I purposely opted to buy Windows 7 
Premium, because I didn't want to deal with Windows 8. Now Microsoft has 
made their list of phase out dates public. Phase out dates are when they 
plan on stopping mainstream updates and support for that operating system. 
Windows 7 is currently set at January of 2015. So yes, Windows 7 users have 
less than one year before Microsoft will stop supporting their OS. You can 
pay for extended support, but that is at your own cost, and it will only 
buy you a few more years time before they stop extended support. Stopping 
support means they stop delivering updates that fix security, software, and 
any other issues associated with the OS itself. So essentially, it's either 
be forced to upgrade, or you're on your own with your OS. The beauty of 
Linux-based systems, there are a shit ton of them. Linux isn't a single 
operating system, it's a plethora of systems built off of the same 
(essentially a baseline/foundation). There are plenty of Linux-based 
systems out there you can obtain for free, have continuous updates, and are 
highly open-source, meaning they're modifiable to the user's preferences, 
allow for mods/addons to be created for them. It is superior in this 
regard. I am considering switching over to a Linux-based system when they 
discontinue support for Windows 7, unless Windows 9 ends up reverting back 
to a more desktop-friendly user interface. Also, be aware, you can have 
multiple operating systems on a computer. msconfig allows you to choose 
which OS boots with your computer. So you could essentially give another 
one a try, and if you don't like it, just remove it.
comments.author: Bloodhound264

comments.text:
+Joseph Kendrick If you think Apple computers cannot get viruses, you don't 
understand how anything works at all, and you're completely talking out of 
your ass. This highly untrue opinion (not fact) has been dis-proven many 
times, and once by the infamous internet group known as Anonymous. Virus, 
malware, trojans, and any form of malicious software has to be coded to 
work on a specific operating system, as well as browsers. This is why it 
appears that Apple computers can't get viruses, because other than for the 
purpose of work, and many school systems using them, they are largely 
unused in the average populace as a personal computer. This creates little 
incentive for hackers to create viruses directed towards Apple systems if 
the target user base if smaller in margin compared to other operating 
systems. Again however, research the subject thoroughly, and you will find 
that Apple-based operating systems are able to be compromised just as other 
OS's are.
comments.author: Bloodhound264

captions.text: These American businesses have stood the test of time
and are positioned to dominate in the 21st century.
Welcome to WatchMojo.com,
and today we're counting down our picks for the top 10 iconic American businesses.
For this list, we've chosen companies that best represent America,
have financially outperformed their competitors,
and whose brand and business resonate with consumers and industry insiders alike.
Better known for its Tide and Crest brands,
P&G is a market leader in every country in which it operates.
'Cause my side had 21 percent fewer cavities with Crest.
Since 1837, the company has launched or acquired products that have fueled profits and market share.
Ranging from personal care items to cleaning agents,
over-the-counter medications to pet foods,
Cincinnati-based P&G has also stocked other corporations with leaders.
More than white, more than bright. Really clean.
Clean.
It went from a local Seattle coffee bean roaster and retailer
to one of the world's largest coffeehouse companies in under 30 years.
If you're looking for a friendly and comfortable place to enjoy high quality coffee,
hot or cold beverages and/or tasty snacks,
look no further than Starbucks.
Deriving over half of its revenues globally,
Google began as a project between two Stanford Ph.D. students.
Within two decades, it emerged as a financial powerhouse
as well as the leading Internet company of all-time,
and has leveraged that dominance with a foray into mobile.
This company's appliances have found homes in kitchens and bathrooms for decades.
But by bringing 'good things to life',
GE has since imagined and developed countless modern
and innovative products beyond the home.
Over a century after its foundation,
the multinational conglomerate corporation now has multiple subsidiaries
and divisions dealing with financial services, energy, technology, infrastructure,
and home and business solutions.
So you can do laundry your way, and finally, take a load off.
There are few American companies as synonymous with footwear,
sports apparel and equipment as Nike.
Any questions?
With its diverse line of shoes for athletes of all kinds, training products and clothing,
the multinational corporation has built itself into the sports business' most valuable brand.
Thanks to memorable advertising and marketing campaigns,
Nike's signature swoosh logo and 'Just Do It' slogan
have also been associated with many prominent international sports stars,
which has given it an unparalleled amount of goodwill with global consumers.
How do you do that?
You'll learn.
Of the three companies that have topped the Fortune 500 since the list was launched in 1955,
Arkansas-based Wal-Mart is the only one that cracked our list based on our criteria.
Despite having its share of critics,
Wal-Mart has endeared itself with its 'always low prices, always.'
With its line of computers, software and consumer electronics,
Apple's gross revenues and profit margins helped it briefly overtake Exxon Mobil
as the world's most valuable company.
Apple counts one of the most passionate and loyal consumer bases of any company,
as was evidenced by the outpouring of emotion when co-founder Steve Jobs passed away.
And we are calling it, 'iPhone'.
Brothers Walt and Roy Disney created Mickey Mouse
shortly after launching their Cartoon Studio in the 1920s in L.A.
They've since shaped the animation industry with some of history's most beloved films.
Hi-ho, hi-ho, it's home from work we go.
The company's expanded its reach into television, music, live-action projects and the web.
By adding merchandising and international theme parks to the mix,
the world's largest media conglomerate is still making dreams come true.
It didn't take long after its first franchise opened in Illinois
for McDonald's to become the world's largest chain of hamburger fast food restaurants.
Since 1955, the corporation defined and refined fast food with its burgers,
fries and various other products.
With its advertising campaigns and golden arches,
Micky D's has become a symbol of the globalization of the American food industry.
And thanks to its adaptability to recent trends, it remains relevant today.
This bubbly, caramel-colored soft drink was originally marketed as medicine in the late 1800s.
The delicious and refreshing beverage's popularity grew so quickly
it was considered an American icon in less than 50 years.
Give yourself a break. Have a coke.
Though its formula remains a secret to this day,
Coke's sweet taste is now known the world over
thanks to the company's clever advertising strategies
and the Coca-Colanization of pop culture.
Do you agree with our list?
Which company do you think is the most iconic American business?
Be sure to subscribe to WatchMojo.com for more entertaining top 10s.
Subtitles by the Amara.org community
